<p>Manages connection with a secure WebS:
Manages connection with a secure WebSocket path to signal the Millicast server and establishes a WebRTC connection to view a live stream.

Before you can view an active broadcast, you will need:

  • A connection path that you can get from {@link Director} module or from your own implementation based on Get a Connection Path.
<p>Millicast existing Stream Name where: Millicast existing Stream Name where you want to connect.
<p>Callback function executed when a new: Callback function executed when a new token is needed.
<p>Target HTML media element to mount st: Target HTML media element to mount stream.
<p>Connects to an active stream as subsc:
Connects to an active stream as subscriber.

In the example, addStreamToYourVideoTag and getYourSubscriberConnectionPath is your own implementation.
<p>True to modify SDP for supporting dtx: True to modify SDP for supporting dtx in opus. Otherwise False.
<p>True to modify SDP for supporting abs: True to modify SDP for supporting absolute capture time header extension. Otherwise False.
<p>Disable the opportunity to receive vi: Disable the opportunity to receive video stream.
<p>Disable the opportunity to receive au: Disable the opportunity to receive audio stream.
<p>Number of audio tracks to recieve VAD: Number of audio tracks to recieve VAD multiplexed audio for secondary sources.
<p>Id of the main source that will be re: Id of the main source that will be received by the default MediaStream.
<p>Do not receive media from the these s: Do not receive media from the these source ids.
<p>Override which events will be deliver: Override which events will be delivered by the server (any of "active" | "inactive" | "vad" | "layers").*
<p>Select the simulcast encoding layer a: Select the simulcast encoding layer and svc layers for the main video track, leave empty for automatic layer selection based on bandwidth estimation.
<p>rid value of the simulcast encoding o: rid value of the simulcast encoding of the track (default: automatic selection)
<p>The spatial layer id to send to the o: The spatial layer id to send to the outgoing stream (default: max layer available)
<p>The temporaral layer id to send to th: The temporaral layer id to send to the outgoing stream (default: max layer available)
<p>Promise object which resolves when th: Promise object which resolves when the connection was successfully established.
<p>Select the simulcast encoding layer a: Select the simulcast encoding layer and svc layers for the main video track
<p>leave empty for automatic layer selec: leave empty for automatic layer selection based on bandwidth estimation.
<p>streams - Streams the stream will bel: streams - Streams the stream will belong to.
<p>Start projecting source in selected m: Start projecting source in selected media ids.
<p>Mapping of the source track ids to th: Mapping of the source track ids to the receiver mids
<p>Track id from the source (received on: Track id from the source (received on the "active" event), if not set the media kind will be used instead.
<p>Track kind of the source ('audio' | ': Track kind of the source ('audio' | 'video'), if not set the trackId will be used instead.
<p>mid value of the rtp receiver in whic: mid value of the rtp receiver in which the media is going to be projected.
<p>Select the simulcast encoding layer a: Select the simulcast encoding layer and svc layers, only applicable to video tracks.
<p>Stop projecting attached source in se: Stop projecting attached source in selected media ids.
<p>mid value of the receivers that are g: mid value of the receivers that are going to be detached.
<p>Promise that will be resolved when th: Promise that will be resolved when the RTCRtpTransceiver is assigned an mid value.
<p>mid value of the rtp receiver in whic: mid value of the rtp receiver in which the media is going to be projected. If no mediaId is defined, the first track from the main media stream with the same media type as the input source track will be used.
<p>Manages connection with a secure WebS:
Manages connection with a secure WebSocket path to signal the Millicast server and establishes a WebRTC connection to view a live stream.

Before you can view an active broadcast, you will need:

  • A connection path that you can get from {@link Director} module or from your own implementation.
<p>Override which events will be deliver: Override which events will be delivered by the server (any of "active" | "inactive" | "vad" | "layers" | "viewercount").*
<p>Ask the server to use the playout del: Ask the server to use the playout delay header extension.
